data.text:
COMMENTS FROM THE REGISTRATION PAGE FOR TAPS ACROSS AMERICA

I‚Äôm a member of Youth Trumpet & Taps Corps (YTTC) and I‚Äôm super pumped about this opportunity!

Trumpet, Miser Road Hill at Flag Pole overlooking Black River

Proud to show support of the fallen in this way. Great idea. I will be in my front yard with my tumpet

Newberry Memorial Gardens, trumpet

Mikayla 16 yrs old I will be playing my trumpet outside at my home.

I‚Äôll be playing Taps on trombone. Twice.

I am going to be at my grandparents house for a social distancing bbq. It is the first time we‚Äôll all be near one another but apart! I‚Äôll be playing my trombone.

Trumpet, Near the flagpoles of the Kauai Veterans Center

I am a retired US Army Combat Veteran. I will be playing Taps on my trumpet in Jacksonville, Florida.

I‚Äôll be sounding live Taps this memorial Day at 3:00PM in Enid, Ok . I have with me a vintage OLD‚Äù Cornet, and my old faithful will resonate Taps in my rural neighborhood. Thanks for the memories and honor to remember the Brave, who gave their lives for the free.

Boy scout playing a Clarinet

I will be playing either on trumpet or trombone

I am a Former Marching Member of the Racine Scouts and The Cavaliers drum and bugle corps and I‚Äôll be playing taps in my drive way also I am currently serving in the army (18 years)

we plan to join friends in a neighborhood nearby if weather permits

At my sisters house with her boyfriend who is a former marine

In my drivewaySlidell, La.‚Äù

I haven‚Äôt decided yet if I‚Äôm playing trumpet, marching baritone, or euphonium. I haven‚Äôt practiced the trumpet for a while, so in the interest of sounding good, it‚Äôll probably be euphonium.

I played Taps at my father‚Äô‚Ñ¢s funeral on August 19, 2012. He proudly served in the US Army and was stationed in Europe during the Korean War. I am dedicating my rendition of Taps in memory of my father Milton A. Mickey Mills and to the brave men and women who served in the armed forces.

At 3PM I‚Äôll be playing from my lawn in Lynn Haven. At 9AM at Kent-Lawn cemetery I‚Äôll be playing Taps at the graveside of L/Cpl Jared W Brown, KIA June 16, 2013 in Afghanistan. Fellow Marine, and I‚Äôll be playing on a bugle, not a trumpet, in my Veteran of Foreign War uniform.

This will be played at Primary Children‚Äôs Hospital because I will be working.

I‚Äôm and American Boy Scout with Troop 401 in London, England and I‚Äôll play my WW1 bugle at 3pm London time.

Outside of house on a keyboard using trumpet sound

trumpet, in honor for my grandfather, aunt‚Äôs and uncles and my beloved father.

‚ÄúI am a collegiate trumpet player

I will be playing from my front lawn overlooking a long and beautiful view‚Äù

I will he playing my trumpet. Probably either outside or my town square.

I am a music educator and will be playing Taps on my French horn.

My son will be performing with me. He recently finished 8th grade band. W will be performing on trumpet and trombone.

Lake Ouachita- Bugle

I am a Senior at Terre Haute South High School and I will be playing my trumpet from my driveway in Terre Haute Indiana.

Yes. My father Antero P. Vistro was a Master Cheif USN. He served 1947-1977. My address is 2940 N Verdugo Road #216 Glendale 91208. I will be in Glorietta Park, Glendale at 3 pm. I am a trumpet player.

Clarinet

Using the family bugle. Family lore says it dates from Civil War.

As a senior in high school, Kade has played with his school‚Äôs marching band in Memorial Day Services for the past 4 years. This year he will play Taps on his tenor sax at the cemetery my dad is buried at.who‚Äôs a Vietnam Veteran. Then he will play it at our town‚Äôs memorarial.

Santa Rosa, CA Trumpet

I will be playing the mellophone. Thank you for organizing this.

I‚Äôll be playing Taps on euphonium in my rural neighborhood.

I was a member of the Air Force Drum and Bugle Corps at Lackland Air Force Base from Feb 10, 1988 to March 24, 1988. I was also the Bugler in the Air Force Honor Guard at England Air Force Base, LA from November 1988 to November 1991.

He is 10 years old and will be playing on the ocarina.

My dad has played Taps at over 1,500 funerals. He played in the Cal Berkeley Band as well as the Marine Band and was the principal trumpet player for the San Luis Obispo Symphony for 42 years. I learned to play the trumpet in the 7th grade, and played it through the 8th grade. I‚Äôve also played the piano my whole life. I will now play Taps on Memorial Day, 2020.

I will play from the front of my house underneath the US flag on a Besson Sovereign Cornet

My contribution will be a tribute to all those who have given their last full measure of devotion to our country, my wonderful father who was WWII combat vet (CIB ‚Äì 2 Bronze Stars- 94th Inf. Division, Patton‚Äôs 3rd Army) who passed in 1987 and, this year, to my very dear 94 year old uncle (my dad‚Äôs brother) who was a stateside WWII vet and I am sad to report just passed away of COVID-19 on Friday 22 May 2020. This may be a hard song for me to ‚Äòget through‚Äô, especially this year. I plan to use the King Silver Flair trumpet my dad bought me back in 1973.

I play taps for military funerals with Miamisburg combined honor guard. We will be firing and playing @ 3 local cemeteries plus lay a wreath at veterans park in Miamisburg Monday morning @ 10 am. I have played with an honor guard for 23 years and some 2700 funerals and events. I will be playing taps in our driveway. I have my original trumpet from starting band in the 5th grade. This is such an honor

I‚Äôll play at the Wildwood Cemetery, in Pillager, MN, at the war veterans memorial.

My son and I are doing it together. We are both trumpet players.

Beaumont, TX

It will be myself and my 2 daughters MacKenzie (21) and Hayley (17) all doing this together as we are all trumpet players.

From my front door, with an Olds Recording Bb trumpet.(1952)
